item.title: The 'Beyoncé Bowl' halftime show was a massive hit for Netflix. The football was too
item.description: Netflix says more than 200 countries tuned into the "Beyoncé Bowl" and its two NFL games. We may just be starting to learn what that ultimately means for the future of television and sports media.

item.title: Israel strikes Houthi targets in Yemen's capital. WHO chief says he was nearby
item.description: A round of Israeli airstrikes targeted the Houthi rebel-held capital and multiple ports. The head of the World Health Organization said the bombardment occurred as he prepared to board a flight.

item.title: Giving a kidney to a stranger? Researchers call it 'extraordinary altruism'
item.description: Only about 300 to 400 people a year give a kidney to someone they never met. It's an act of generosity so unusual, a neuroscientist studies the people who do this.

item.title: Manmohan Singh, India's prime minister from 2004 to 2014, has died
item.description: Singh was known as the father of economic reforms in India. He served as finance minister in the early 1990s, and his policies then set India on the path of economic liberalization and globalization.

item.title: Aviation experts say Russia's air defense fire likely caused Azerbaijan plane crash
